notesStmt.note: Attached flyleaf [ii]: a testamentary direction of Anne Kennicott: 'After my death this Book is to be given to the British Museum as a part of Mr Cracherode's Legacy.The initials E.I.L.P: on the flyleaf next to the title-page [iii recto].
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Seder tiḳune Shabat, a kabbalistic book of prayers for the Sabbath, and the Pentateuch lections for Mondays and Thursdays throughout the year.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi square and semi cursive script (the 'Amsterdam font') of the early 18th century. Punctuated.
